romainfrancois commented on issue #2767: ARROW-3526: [R] update R package install instructions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2767#issuecomment-430131384
 
 
   Actually, `vctrs` is in the remotes, so `install_github` will work fine without these additional instructions. 
   
   ```
   Remotes:
       r-lib/vctrs, 
       RcppCore/Rcpp
   ```

jameslamb commented on issue #2767: ARROW-3526: [R] update R package install instructions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2767#issuecomment-431539312
 
 
   @romainfrancois what do you want to do with this PR?
   
   `R CMD INSTALL` does not respect `Remotes`, and in fact `R CMD CHECK` will throw a NOTE and say "I don't understand what Remotes is".

----------------------------------------------------------------

romainfrancois commented on issue #2767: ARROW-3526: [R] update R package install instructions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2767#issuecomment-431557600
 
 
   That's why we have this in the instructions: 
   
   ```r
   devtools::install_github("apache/arrow/r")
   ```
   
   Alternatively, we can install locally with this, from the root of the repo (we'd have I guess ti add `cd ../..` after `make install`): 
   
   ```r
   devtools::install("r")
   ```

wesm closed pull request #2767: ARROW-3526: [R] update R package install instructions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2767
 
 
   

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/r/README.md b/r/README.md
index 868fdff0a0..39c0be4b1b 100644
--- a/r/README.md
+++ b/r/README.md
@@ -10,14 +10,25 @@ R integration with Apache Arrow.
 First install a release build of the C++ bindings to arrow.
 
 ``` shell
+# Get source
 git clone https://github.com/apache/arrow.git
-cd arrow/cpp && mkdir release && cd release
+cd arrow
+
+# Create install dir
+mkdir -p cpp/release
+cd cpp/release
 
 # It is important to statically link to boost libraries
 cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DARROW_BOOST_USE_SHARED:BOOL=Off
 make install
 ```
 
+The R package depends on `vctrs`, which as of this writing is not available on CRAN. Install it [from Github](https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs):
+
+``` r
+devtools::install_github("r-lib/vctrs")
+```
+
 Then the R package:
 
 ``` r

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
The R package currently relies on [vctrs|https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs[],|https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs] a project that as of now is not on CRAN or any other major package repository.

This is not mentioned in the installation instructions or anywhere else. Developers who do not already have *vctrs* (an experimental package) will get an error complaining about its absence when they try to install the arrow R package.

I recommend explicitly adding install instructions for it to the README for the R package.
fields.summary: [R] Installation relies on package not available on CRAN

comments.body:
I don't think this is an issue, because the installation instructions involve `install_github` which knows about installing packages with declared `Remotes` in the DESCRIPTION. 

Moreover, `vctrs` is soon on CRAN.
This package is still a ways away from being on CRAN AFAIK
What should happen to this JIRA?
This only makes sense to think about this when we release. Closing the issue now.
